Posts.Content: Dec 16, 2010 01:18PM mbw wrote: Amelia Well we are sisters in timing....I'm on the same timing track.  However, I'm turning 69 in less than two weeks and my dilemma is whether to do any reconstrution after my choice to take both breasts regardless of whether their may or may not be a new concern (after MRI) in left breast..  My breast surgeon (top of her game, clinical professor ont subject) says that it's much more complicated to do a good reconstruction after waiting a year.... Too, because of other medical conditions including borderline diabetes (for 4 years, I haven't crossed the threshold) and C.L.L, she recommends against flaps and recommends only implants.  From what I read, there are more infections and problems with the implants and I am not sure I want to be bothered....I know for sure that I don't want to be bothered until I am back feeling 100% because I was only just returning to normalcy through PT following knee replacement surgery in September. (Bought my first pair of hiking boots to celebrate --- the morning of the day I was called back for further diagnostics after a mammogram earlier that month).  I am particularly interested in talking to women who either A) chose no reconstruction after a bilateral mastectomy ....or 2) delayed the choice..   I can add that a friend who chose none after a single mastectomy told me her regret was not to have done both to put worries behind her AND so she was balanced when not choosing to wear a prothesis.  Serendipty, I happened to encounter a senior nurse who had been on the BC surgery ward...   After assuring me of the care available, when I told her my dilemma, she said that the nurses often discussed "what we would do" after treating people out of surgery and she said that the "100 we said we wouldn't reconstruct".   But, I keep worrying that people are telling me what they think I would want to hear and I would love to talk to someone who is or having made the decision not to reconstruct....or at least not right away.  (If I am in the wrong forum please redirect me).  Meanwhile my next step is a follow-up MRI for a MRI-guided biopsy of 3 suspect areas...two in the breast already biopsied and a new one in the left breast....
Posts.Title: New DX- Trying to decide- Please help! steeleamelia momand2kids

Posts.Content: Jan 11, 2011 11:37PM mbw wrote: This forum is most helpful...thanks to all of you who are a month or two ahead of me.  I was diagnosed with tiny, tiny (7mm) IDC grade 1 in November...but with a caveat that I should have MRI regarding 2 suspect abnormalities in same breast if "Tiny" was BC.  The holidays got in the way of speedy follow-up (my BC surgeon said not to worry due to non-aggressive grade 1)   Had a a horrendous MRI experience mid December (had to repeat b/c the first time they went through the vein and shot the contrast into the arm)...I was therefore freaked about today's MRI guided biopsy on BOTH breasts (surprise result of the prior MRI")   But went to a different venue (UCSF breast radiology) and it was such a different supportive experience that it has me rethinking my plan for PMX if the areas biopsied today are clear. [Had always envisioned PMX since my mother's death from BC].   One of reasons for my jumping to PMX (even though BC suggested lumpectomy with reduction/lift of left breast) was to avoid this testing ...wait...testing...wait process in the future.  I get the results next week and then I am presuming that I'll finally get a date.  In response to an earlier post about reconstruction...Unless I DO end up going with surgeons choice of lumpectomy, I am choosing to delay a year to see if I miss breasts at all and to recover from the stress of this whole process (which followed by 2 months, knee replacement surgery that prevented my exercise program so I just don't feel in shape)...But did check out that despite then being age 70, I can, when I feel healthy including completing knee PT, do DIEP thereby shortening my first surgery.   I AM interested if any one has post MX pain (PMP) which I just read about to begin thinking about post surgery versus the what and when? Again, my main reason (other than asking about PMP ) is to thank you gals who are giving post surgery feedback and time-lines...It sounds like many of you are back at work at 3 weeks while it took 5 after my knee replacement.  I want to get back into the pool for water aerobics as soon as possible! Any of you know how soon you can get back in a pool post surgery?
